key_insight: Vulcan uses LLM-driven search to automatically synthesize tiny, instance-optimal heuristics specialized to a particular workload and hardware, replacing slow manual design with fast, tailored rules that outperform general-purpose heuristics.
problem_solved: Designing performant resource-management heuristics (scheduling, caching, AQM, etc.) is costly and brittle because workloads and hardware constantly change; Vulcan automates producing heuristics tuned to each specific instance.
method: Use a large language model to generate candidate heuristic programs/policies expressed as small, interpretable rules.
Evaluate candidates on the target workload and hardware via fast simulation or measurement, and iteratively refine/search to find instance-optimal options.
Select and output lightweight, deployable heuristics with validation against baselines (hand-designed rules) to ensure practical benefits.
impact: AI/ML practitioners get automated, workload-specific resource-management rules that improve performance and efficiency without manual tuningâ€”enabling better utilization of hardware and faster iteration on infrastructure.

paper_title: Vulcan: Instance-Optimal Systems Heuristics Through LLM-Driven Search
paper_authors: Rohit Dwivedula, Divyanshu Saxena, Sujay Yadalam, Daehyeok Kim, Aditya Akella
